question: What is the purpose of a limiting head ($h_{lim}$) in MNW simulations? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. The limiting head is a control to protect the well from overdraw.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. $h_{lim}$ is a lower elevation bound for head in the well to protect the pump.

question: What happens when the computed $h_{well}$ falls below $h_{lim}$? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. The system adjusts Q to keep the well head at the threshold.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Aquifer head and parameters stay constant — only Q is limited.

question: Under what conditions does the MNW model resume pumping using the Qmx limit? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Qmx defines the minimum discharge required to restart pumping after it was stopped due to head constraints.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Qmx only becomes relevant when the well is inactive and conditions improve sufficiently to restart pumping.

question: A MNW well is pumping water with the desired discharge $Q_{des}$. The head in the well is above the limiting head. What kind of boundary condition represents MNW for this state? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. If $h_{well}$ is above $h_{lim}$ the discharge is not constrained and specified as $Q_{des}$. And $Q_{des}$ is not depending on the cell water head $h_{aq}$.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. If MNW pumps with $Q_{des}$ and $h_{well}$ is above $h_{lim}$ then the boundary is of second type. This is visible by the vertical line in the Q versus h plot.

question: What happens when the well head reaches the threshold head and the discharge falls below Qmn? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. If Q < Qmn under limiting head conditions, pumping stops and the well becomes inactive.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Qmn defines the lowest allowable pumping rate — below this, the pump shuts off.

question: When and how does the MNW model resume pumping after a shutdown due to low head? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Excellent. MNW restarts a well only when both head and Q conditions improve above defined limits.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Qmx and threshold head are key conditions for restarting pumping after protective shutdown.
